forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> It is possible to boot with (ISO) or Disk Image (IMG) files with VISTA loader.

NO.  

The most you can do is to chainload from the Vista loader the NTLDR from XP/2003 which can chainload a bootsector throgh BOOT.INI.  

From that bootsector you can chainload a DOS of some kind (in root of the volume, NOT in a IMG or ISO) or another NT loader, possibly using a .IMG or .ISO using RAMDISK to boot a PE of some kind or a full XP with the Euhenio's method.  

To load a DOS image you need a bootloader of some kind, grub4dos, which you appear to like not, or syslinux/isolinux/memdisk or siblo:  
[http://syslinux.zytor.com/](http://syslinux.zytor.com/ "External link")  
[http://simplux.org/siblo/index.html](http://simplux.org/siblo/index.html "External link")  

This is standard reference site for multibooting VISTA:  
[http://www.multibooters.co.uk/](http://www.multibooters.co.uk/ "External link")
